turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What did you find, Junior?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Junior?! Dad...

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I like Indiana.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: We named the dog Indiana.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Ready.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: After you, Junior.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Yes, sir!  Haaa!

turns.speaker: KNIGHT
turns.text: I knew you'd come, but my strength has left me.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: KNIGHT
turns.text: The last of three brothers who swore an oath to find the Grail and to guard it.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: That was seven hundred years ago.

turns.speaker: KNIGHT
turns.text: A long time to wait.

turns.speaker: KNIGHT
turns.text: You're strangely dressed... for a knight.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I'm not exactly... a knight. What do you mean?

turns.speaker: KNIGHT
turns.text: I was chosen because I was the bravest and the most worthy. The honor was mine until another came to challenge me to single combat. I pass it to you who vanquished me.

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: Get that camel out of the way!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: What happened to Marcus, Sallah?

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: Ah, they set out across the desert this afternoon. I believe they took Mister Brody with them.

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: That car belonged to my brother-in- law.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Come on -- come on!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I'm going after those horses.

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: I'll take the camels.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I don't need camels.

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: But, Indy --

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: No camels!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Sallah, I said no camels! That's five camels. Can't you Count?

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: Compensation for my brother-in-law's car. Indy, your father and Brody --

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Where's my father?

turns.speaker: SALLAH
turns.text: They have them. In the belly of that steel beast.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Why are you trying to kill us?

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: Because you're looking for the Holy Grail.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: My father was looking for the Holy Grail. Did you kill him too?

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Where is he? Talk -- or you're dead. Damn it, tell me! Tell me!

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: If you don't let go, Doctor Jones, we'll both die.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Then we'll die.

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: My soul is prepared. How's yours?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: This is your last chance.

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: No, Doctor Jones. It's yours!

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: All right! Where's my father

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: If you let me go, I will tell you where he is.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: My name is Kazim.

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: And why were you trying to kill me?

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: The secret of the Grail has been safe for a thousand years. And for all that time the Brotherhood of the Cruciform Sword has been prepared to do anything to keep it safe.

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: Ask yourself, why do you seek the Cup of Christ? Is it for His glory, or for yours?

turns.speaker: INDY
turns.text: I didn't come for the Cup of Christ. I came to find my father.

turns.speaker: KAZIM
turns.text: In that case, God be with you in your quest. Your father is being held in the Castle of Brunwald on the Austrian-German border.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: Captain Blumburtt and his troops are here to check up on the "natives".

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Just a routine inspection tour.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: The British worry so about their Empire -- it makes us feel like well- cared-for children.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: Dr. Jones, you know very well that the Thuggee cult has been dead for nearly a century.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Of course. The Thuggees were an obscenity that worshipped Kali with human sacrifices. The British Army wiped them out about the time of the Mutiny of 1857.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Well, Mr. Prime Minister, my report will duly note that we found nothing unusual here in Pankot.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: I'm sure that will please the Maharajah, Captain.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: As I said before, we'd be happy to escort you to Delhi.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Interested in local curios?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: No. But I am interested in the occult. And this is a kryta.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Charming.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: It's like the voodoo dolls of West Africa. The kryta represents your enemy -- and gives you complete power over him.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Thank God all that mumbo jumbo rubbish is disappearing.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You think so?

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Of course. Admittedly, it's taken time. Britain's controlled India for almost two hundred years now.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You're hanging on better here than you did in America.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: This is a different situation, Dr. Jones. These people are like children. We have to lead them slowly into the twentieth century.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: The Prime Minister doesn't seem that naive.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: No, he's a very shrewd old boy. Power behind the throne and all that. He actually runs this whole province.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: I'm sure it's nothing. Just rumors.  What was it they claimed was stolen?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Something magical. A sacred rock.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Rather bizarre menu, wouldn't you say?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Even if they were trying to scare us away, a devout Hindu would never touch meat.  Makes you wonder what these people are...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I've spent by life crawling around in caves and tunnels -- I shouldn't have let somebody like Willie go in there with me.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Miss Scott panicked?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: When she saw the insects she passed out cold. I carried her back to her room. She was sleeping when I re- entered the tunnel to look around.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Then she must have run out of the room and you found her.

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Did you discover anything in that tunnel, Dr. Jones?

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: I believe we're being called to dinner.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Finally!

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Jones isn't in his room. Miss Scott -- my troops are leaving at dawn if you want us to escort you to Delhi --

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: No -- you can't go! Something awful's happened. They've got Short Round and I think Indy's been --

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: We found a tunnel that leads to a temple below the palace! Please, come with me, I'll show you!

turns.speaker: CAPT. BLUMBURTT
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: It's some kind of cult! And they've got the sacred stones that Indy was searching for.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Hard to believe, isn't it...?

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: I remember first hearing your name when I was studying at Oxford. I am Chattar Lal, Prime Minister for His Highness the Maharajah of Pankot.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: The plane crash and your journey here sound -- most incredible.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You should have been there...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: He's not exactly what we call "a spring chicken".

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: No, no, that is Uhmed Singh, the present Maharajah's late father.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Oh -- good. And maybe the present Maharajah is a little younger? And thinner?

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: They will escort you to your rooms now. You will be provided with fresh clothes. Tonight you will be dining with His Highness.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Dinner? And with a prince?! My luck is changing. But look at me -- my god, I've to get ready!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Listen, Mr. Lal, what do you call the Maharajah's wife?

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: His Highness has not yet taken a wife.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: No? Well, I guess he just hasn't met the right woman...

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: Miss Scott, you're not making any sense.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I'm afraid they'll kill them! We saw horrible things down there -- they had a human sacrifice and they ripped a man's heart out!

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: I sense the fumes of opium in all this. Perhaps Miss Scott picked up the habit in Shanghai.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: What're you talking about -- I'm not a dope fiend! I saw it! I'll show you!

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: I would say you look rather lost.  But then I cannot imagine where in the world the three of you would look at home...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Lost? No, we're not lost. We're on our way to Delhi. This is Miss Scott -- and Mr. Round. My name's Indiana Jones.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: Dr. Jones? The eminent archaeologist?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: We'd appreciate it if the Maharajah would let us stay tonight. We'll be on out way in the morning.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: I am only his humble servant, but the Maharajah usually listens to my advice.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I had a question, Mr. Prime Minister. I was examining some of the Maharajah's artifacts.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: A very fine collection of very old pieces, don't you think?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Yes, very fine. But not all of the pieces look old. Some were carved recently and look like images used by the Thuggees to worship the goddess Kali.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I suppose stories of the Thuggees die hard.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: There are no stories anymore.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Well, I don't know... we came here from a small village and the peasants there told us that the Pankot Palace was growing powerful again -- because of some ancient evil.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: Their stories are just fear and folklore.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Maybe... but how do you explain The Thuggee shrine I saw right below the palace?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You know the villagers also claimed that this palace stole something from them.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: Dr. Jones, in our country a guest does not usually insult his host.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Sorry, I thought we were just talking about folklore.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: There, you see, Captain. A rock!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: When they lost this rock their fields and animals died. They also said their children were taken from them.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: I think that's enough of this nonsense, Dr. Jones...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I was dubious myself at first. Then something connected -- the village's rock and the old legend of the Sankara Stones...

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: Dr. Jones, we are all vulnerable to vicious rumors. I seem to remember that in Honduras you were accused of being a grave robber rather than a scientist.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: The newspapers exaggerated the incident.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: And didn't the Sultan of Madagascar threaten to cut your head off if you ever returned to his country?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: That was a misunderstanding.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: Exactly what we have here, Dr. Jones.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: Mola Ram is telling the faithful of out victory. He says the British have left the palace, which proves Kali Ma's new power.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Yes, I understand.

turns.speaker: CHATTAR LAL
turns.text: You understand what he tells us?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Kali Ma protects us now and for ever, and we must pledge our devotion by worshipping her with an offering of flesh and blood!

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Dr. Jones.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Lao She.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Nee chin lie how ma?

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: You never told me you spoke my language, Dr. Jones.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I don't like to show off.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: So, it is true, Dr. Jones? You found Nurhachi?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Sure, I found him. Then last night I had a little trouble. Somebody tried to slit my throat.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: You have insulted my son.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Next time I'll cut off more than his finger.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: Dr. Jones -- I want Nurhachi.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: A bonus, Dr. Jones. That is poison. You just drank the rest of it.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Now what about the antidote, Lao.

turns.speaker: LAO
turns.text: At last I have the ashes of my sacred ancestor!

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Wow! Holy smoke! Crash landing!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Step on it, Short Round!

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Okey-doke, Indy! Hold onto your potatoes!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You got the tickets, Short Round?

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Sure, Indy -- three tickets! You, me and Wu Han --

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Indy?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Okay, Shorty.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Indy, they make our plane crash? To get you here?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: It's just superstition, Shorty. Like a ghost story.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: I ride with you, Indy?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Nope, you got a little surprise over there, Shorty.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Indy, look!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: That's it. Pankot Palace.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: What you look at, Indy?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Just a statue.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: That little Maharajah think he big stuff.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You don't like him do you?

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Next time I flatten him! Did you see his eyes?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Indy, they glow like fire and get real crazy! Then he talk in this real scary voice!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: He was afraid of you. He knows a tough guy when he sees one.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Yeah, that's what happened...

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Get to sleep Indy -- I stay up and keep eye on things...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Okay, Shorty... see you in the morning... I'm going to have a little -- word with Willie.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: What does it mean, Indy?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: "Follow in the footsteps of Shiva. Do not betray his truth."

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: The village knew their rock was magic -- but they didn't know it was one of the lost Sankara Stones...

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Why they glow like that?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Legend says that when the stones are brought together the diamonds inside of them will glow.

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: This is Nainsukh -- from the village. They bring him here to dig in the mines.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Come one, what's wrong?

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Behind you!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Slow on the curves or we'll fly off the tracks!

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: Read you loud and clear, Indy!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Let up on the brake!

turns.speaker: SHORT ROUND
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MOLA RAM
turns.text: You were caught trying to steal the Sankara Stones.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Nobody's perfect. The way I heard it, you stole one of them from a small village.

turns.speaker: MOLA RAM
turns.text: There were five stones in the beginning. Over the centuries they were dispersed by wars, sold off by thieves like you...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Two are still missing.

turns.speaker: MOLA RAM
turns.text: No. They are here -- somewhere. A century ago when the British raided this temple and butchered my people, a loyal priest hid the last two stones down here in the catacombs.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: That's what you've got these children -- these slaves digging for?

turns.speaker: MOLA RAM
turns.text: They dig for the gems to support our cause. They also search for the last two stones. Soon we will have all five Sankara Stones and the Thuggees will be all powerful!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Nobody can say you don't have a vivid imagination.

turns.speaker: MOLA RAM
turns.text: You do not believe me? You will, Dr. Jones. You will become a true believer.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: That's far enough!

turns.speaker: MOLA RAM
turns.text: You are in no position to give orders, Dr. Jones.

turns.speaker: MOLA RAM
turns.text: Give me the stones!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Mola Ram -- you're about to meet Kali -- in Hell!

turns.speaker: MOLA RAM
turns.text: No, the stones are mine!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You're betrayed Shiva.

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: On the way to Delhi, you will stop at Pankot.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Pankot isn't on the way to Delhi.

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: You will go to palace there.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Hasn't the Pankot palace been deserted since the Mutiny of 1857?

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: No. Now there is new Maharajah -- and palace is powerful again.

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: It is Pankot Palace that kills my village.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I don't understand. What's happened here?

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: The evil starts in Pankot. Then like monsoon, it moves darkness over all country.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: What evil?

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: They came from Palace and took sivalinga from out village.

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: It is why Krishna brought you here.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Nobody brought us here. Our plane crashed. We were shot down by --

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: No. We pray to Krishna to help us find the stone. It was Krishna who made you fall from sky -- so you can got to Pankot Palace. To find sivalinga -- and bring back to us.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Was the stone very smooth?  It was probably brought here from a sacred river.

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: Long ago -- before my father's father.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: And it had three lines painted across it?  The lines represent the three levels of the universe. I've seen stones like the one you lost.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: But why would the Maharajah take this sacred stone?

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: They say we must pray to their evil god. We say we will not.

turns.speaker: SHAMAN
turns.text: You will find them when you find sivlalinga.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I'm sorry, I don't know how I can help you here.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: I like the service here.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Hey, he's not a waiter...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: No, Wu Han's an old friend I brought along.  So, the game's not over. Put the antidote on the table, Lao.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Look out, damn it, I need that antidote!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Who cares? Where's that diamond!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: For crying out loud, a kid's driving the car?!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Relax, I've been giving him lessons.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Listen, we just met for crissake! I'm not that kind of girl!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Don't get your hopes up -- where's the antidote?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You don't look very good.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Poison never agrees with me.  Pull a right, Short Round, and head for the Wang Poo bridge!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: What're we going to do?! Where're we going?!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: The airport... No, look out, Short Round! Left, left!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I'll take the extra ticket.  Where's this plane going anyway?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Siam.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Siam? But I'm not dressed for Siam...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: So, what're you supposed to be, a lion tamer?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Since I was nice enough to let you tag along, why don't you give your mouth a rest? Okay, doll?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I'm freezing. What do you mean, tag along? From the minute you walked into that nightclub, you haven't been able to keep your eyes off me.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Are you crazy, a lift raft?! We're not sinking, we're crashing!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Get over here, damn it! Short Round, come on, grab onto me tight!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: No... I'm not cut out for the kind of life you lead.  Oh no... I ripped my dress. Where are we anyway?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: India...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Holy cow -- India? How do you know we're in --

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: He told me they knew I was coming here.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: What do you mean -- how?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: The old man saw it in a dream.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Dream -- nightmare is more like it.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: He said that's whey they were at river -- they were waiting for the plane to fall down.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: God, I am starving, but I can't eat this...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: That's more food than these people eat in a week.  They're starving, too...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Took what?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: It's a sacred stone in a shine that's supposed to protect a village.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: And then they took their children.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Their children?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: What'd he say now?

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: It was destined that I came here -- and the future cannot be changed...

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Hey, Willie -- I think you better get out now.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Stark naked? You wish... If you're trying to seduce me, Dr. Jones, this is a very primitive approach.

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Me seduce you? Honey, you're the one who took your clothes off.  I just came over to remind you that you never know what else might be in the water.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Somehow I feel safer in here.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Indy! Help me!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Don't worry, I'm coming in! What is it?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: A snake!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: A what...?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: A SNAKE!!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Hurry, help me out of here! What're you waiting for?!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Uh, listen -- Willie -- I got a better idea.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: First of all -- don't panic!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Don't let it pull you deeper!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: It's pulling me deeper!

turns.speaker: INDIANA
turns.text: Don't let it curl around you!

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: It's curling around me! Damn it, stop talking and do something!
